concept.title: Typewriter Line Spacing Options
concept.shortdesc: The line spacing options on your typewriter determine the platen movement after each line of text.

ul.li:
Single spacing: Produces the most compact text layout.
Single spacing is often used for drafts, notes, or documents where space efficiency is prioritized. This spacing provides minimal vertical distance between lines, giving a dense text appearance.

Double spacing: Provides balanced spacing between lines, improving legibility and visual clarity.
Double spacing is the most common choice for formal documents, academic writing, or any material that may require annotations.

Triple spacing: Creates wide separation between lines.
Triple spacing is typically used for editing, proofreading, or instructional material where additional space is needed for comments or corrections.

section.title: Line Spacing in Manual Typewriters
section.p: A manual typewriter allows you to adjust line spacing using preset options such as 1, 2, or 3.
